document.title: Ohio’s Library Guidelines for Learners June 2021

6C00E89C18244C6A896332F61632197A.description:
Understand features unique to publishing or creating material on print, digital or multimedia formats,
such as permanence and wide accessibility.

D12572EC13F84D83826EEEEEDEC529ED.description:
Protect personal privacy, respect the privacy of others and navigate multimedia formats safely when
participating in a democratic society.

4792E9ED272E4259AC71EA8081076763.description: Recognize the significance of print, digital and multimedia formats for intercultural dialogue.

61F34AE823FB496EA4AE071EFE672BF9.description: Seek permission before displaying information or images of others.

3023331859FF4DF8ABBD6ADD58568AFD.description: Understand the laws and amendments that address intellectual freedom and censorship.

ACB1B4FCC0DD4001876C57BFDF02291B.description:
ACT: Develop informed, reflective and
engaged participation essential for a
democratic society recognizing that
media is a part of culture and
function as agents of socialization
(NAMLE).

FF1139D78E184FB2A9F7FC3C833469C1.description: Create a print, digital or multimedia message to publish and share with a specific audience.

461B38AEB6944F8D91A737A78DD86E55.description:
Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information for a specific
purpose.

A912AB6731F8485EBAE603B7E240D3EA.description:
Integrate and evaluate information presented in various media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively and verbally.

A7AD44C349C143F7A17753C82097A929.description:
Individually or collaboratively, use a variety of tools to design and create print, digital and multimedia
content.

B83A3AB4764F41BB9F6A2882B8E9952E.description:
CREATE, SHARE AND
COLLABORATE: Develop a message, alone or in a
group, select an appropriate medium
and create a message that meets the
needs of a specific audience.

460D840AA3BD4EB0AC5E0E508FD2E7DE.description: Recognize their own bias as they engage with print, digital and multimedia sources.

FD50613B79444037A6899B46923F5BCA.description:
Analyze what voices are present, which voices are missing and how these decisions influence the
audience.

977257077E0E4CDBA6C3998B1A8594E4.description: Analyze media for purpose, message, points of view, accuracy, bias and intended audience.

48E9489E50644B40901733E4D1E52BB4.description:
Evaluate design elements of various kinds of media productions to determine the creator's purpose
for academic or personal use.

C6BBE1DBBDD344158589F581279D34DB.description:
ANALYZE AND EVALUATE: Analyze and evaluate media formats
and messages for accuracy, validity,
social and emotional context and
appropriateness for need.

A8B2735D29CC44D78719C0A622A8C404.description: Understand and access media ethically and safely for personal and academic use.

B583ED1E54334E5DBE132D8EA300B7AF.description: Grow as independent users of print, digital and multimedia sources for personal and academic use.

05F442B7537D46FE947798FC4467D488.description: Seek out messages from authors and creators from diverse backgrounds and beliefs.

E25AFB600C5A452A806AEB56D8D11E57.description: Understand the content and effect of the persuasive uses of multimedia sources.

640B80AD74874C67922DDF930EFD7B60.description: Access and understand diverse types of print, digital and multimedia sources.

5B03C8F320314113BFF569EE701B33B8.description:
ACCESS: Explore the world of information for
personal and educational use
through a variety of formats.

7392A58B90DB47FC9E4F6C98144361EE.description:
MEDIA LITERACY: According to National Association for Media Literacy Education (NAMLE), “Media literacy is the ability to ACCESS, ANALYZE, EVALUATE,
CREATE, and ACT using all forms of communication. In its simplest terms, media literacy builds upon the foundation of traditional literacy and offers
new forms of reading and writing. Media literacy empowers people to be critical thinkers and makers, effective communicators and active citizens.”

BFE299E994CA4E60863772C22FD58B0E.description:
Design a plan for selecting information and the use of both print and digital resources for future
inquiry.

51582043807A44E68EABE27DF752AEAF.description:
Create questions about how the selection of information from print and digital resources contributed
to the information learned about the topic of inquiry.

A55D055406F14D8FA8016E70CCE3FD8C.description:
Formulate questions and topics for independent study, related to a future unit of study or as a focus
for a self-directed inquiry project (capstone project, research project).

FD7DFA54C61D4E2D98C8D3400480888A.description: Articulate how reflection deepens learners’ personal understanding of the topic of inquiry.

13D5C9C373354C81ACE5E4E8B42CBECF.description: Analyze depth of understanding of a topic gained through the inquiry process.

681E4EC0EF014A82AF8C1295C0DF4487.description:
EXTEND – FORMULATE: Develop questions for further
exploration and to extend learning.
Reflect on the collection, research,
collaboration and application of
information from multiple types of
sources.

36131C6452514E6DBAD2AEAA19D74998.description: Select the communication tool and resource most appropriate for the task.

4BB198830D2F4814A569E30A89E0B35F.description: Solicit, respond and provide constructive feedback to peers and adults.

DF1BF916546C4A1381F99576DFD0FF9B.description: Use information to generate products for publication and discourse.

B0971CCE3CBD498B8F370DA646020A50.description: . Document sources using a standard format for citation.

91CAB4E83B35416B8EF265A72A314A7E.description: Value diversity in groups and recognize the need for multiple viewpoints in problem-solving.

61F15CCFC9674302B3FBD6FEEBC85D00.description:
SHARE AND COLLABORATE: Create and distribute information with
others in an inclusive environment.

3154B01C2C5843DCB139F32614A50DC2.description: Evaluate evidence to determine its relevance, credibility and significance.

917CF40E57B6418B8137543939B79B14.description: Read closely to determine how text evidence supports claims and counterclaims.

5805C7381D5C47DC8FA4B19467671551.description: Create an effective platform to collect, organize and present information.

AAEB3A1F39144A898AA31C585B30E283.description: Use an appropriate method for collecting information from digital and/or print resources.

B7BB925D2D074948AD78C26884EAA3FF.description:
COLLECT: Record, classify and use information
and resources in a meaningful way.

7BAF8F549E2F4B6DBADA957DB57AF673.description: Cite contextual evidence in a legal and ethical manner.

A45B5C724E2840C2BCDD6D20AAE09A95.description: Use, synthesize and evaluate sources in a variety of mediums.

FDE07A8400D44557A4B8A7CC816E1EC2.description: Use primary and/or secondary source materials.

D4D62331DABF4B7AAB96C7C098262825.description: Formulate advanced searches to narrow or broaden a search.

7AF7706D4FE3439EB156884B229564DB.description: Construct a search using keywords to locate a variety of sources.

4BC27C095DBA4235A3F0CF44ED999C00.description: Evaluate and select text evidence to answer questions and support claims.

47B3D3F394664531BC19F3F7466EA56E.description: Conduct extended research projects using a research process model.

8FA07EF9F24E40B491009F10AE0FFD70.description:
RESEARCH AND EXPLORE: Use resources to search and
evaluate information in a safe, legal
and ethical manner.

83BEE00184E94B75B0966E1CF628959F.description: Analyze the topic or research problem, considering what others think within a global context.

73A70CF3B16343CB83E01C8BC564C333.description: Reflect on prior knowledge and previous experience to add context to research findings.

5B8D273E2BD34AFC8A9390DBB36BC09D.description: Consider the research process and steps to achieve learning goals.

7851F2CE20334A67BAA827DC031328F8.description: Formulate essential questions about a topic or problem.

D820B9C252274D60AB16853C7E0BC1AE.description: Set research goals that connect to the project and to learners’ own learning interests.

40C5A33E7C43419B9ED942C6719E3E7D.description:
QUESTION AND ANALYZE: Deepen curiosity and inquiry by
considering prior knowledge, learning
interests and the broader context
before setting research goals and
forming a research plan.

8BE86F770F184CA9AA3C0232923BA94D.description:
INFORMATION LITERACY: Learners recognize when information is needed and can locate, evaluate, search and use information effectively.
(American Library Association, 2019).

82EFD2B490A2487C8794BB8F9CCEC045.description: Use reading as a springboard for inspiring change for the betterment of the community and society.

7915A68066A84A3887B68F0CBF1FFA5B.description:
Engage with a diverse community of readers, participating in discussions to formulate new opinions
and conclusions while considering multiple perspectives.

E434E714E734435988F59F1058ACDCBA.description: Read a variety of genres for pleasure and personal growth, selecting for purpose or criteria.

0E70A8EC863F4749841DA231CF31FBE9.description: Use technology and reviews to select materials to read, view and listen to for personal growth.

344BB44CEA1F479386558779B12FB483.description: Read while considering previous reading experience, personal and societal viewpoints.

321F8CF3E7DA4C80B366F339E26EC521.description: Read independently and collaboratively for enjoyment and personal growth.

204697FED08D447FB2524000EE382E78.description:
Use a library materials management system to select informational and fictional materials of varied
genres.

D55C0977056D4560A589B04DB971CB33.description:
Select materials, read, empathize,
reflect and share ideas to pursue
personal growth and to improve
society.

D199E4DA57C24D909F7F8A45327AF5A8.description: FOUNDATIONS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING AND LITERACY: Learners select materials, read, empathize, reflect and share ideas to pursue personal growth and to improve society.

7676A0B66FD94C6BB1CF9D67B14C34AA.description: Comply with software license agreements and permissions.

4FA879883B9B4327A0BEF58387CA3025.description: Explain the legal consequence for malicious hacking and software piracy.

E935CFD3597148B39EC555C0686E9163.description: Model the use of the school’s digital pledge.

0D755494A8B44E0E8F58E7B96A46229D.description: Analyze the impact and consequences of sexting and harassment.

C91A71E78CB04D53BDD9EDC6FEC4C6AA.description: Practice the fair use of copyrighted materials (images, music, video, text).

89516454596F44ADA917897440F0B0C6.description: Interpret copyright laws and the consequences for violating intellectual property and plagiarism.

38A5BC65324B45F7B3FD1C2252AE4690.description:
ETHICAL USE: Use digital tools ethically and
responsibly.

D59FC4BF1B324A33BA8D4E4CF8F75B2D.description: Discuss the mental health consequences of cyberbullying and harassment.

9634B4CB9BDB4C6092C0049703335148.description: Practice making good choices to avoid peer pressure in social online situations.

0264EE5B17AD400CB8329E6F46642A48.description: Devise strategies to deal with cyberbullying and harassment.

1AF6ED190D44438195FF305D6D805589.description: Model safe practices when collaborating online, including spotting potentially dangerous situations.

0E87977EBA334DA5A867752392ACEB11.description:
SAFETY: Follow rules of personal privacy and
safety when using the internet and
collaborating with others.

E8E94DA908894DC2969BF63B7D3BF9A6.description: Select and use digital tools to answer research questions and cite sources appropriately.

FFB0F0DEC5CF4BCB8468829D563522FD.description:
Apply advanced research strategies, searches, synthesis and source evaluation to produce digital
artifacts and online content.

AF7D07273F3A481EB35A05254A55D730.description: Communicate and publish content online using various digital tools.

871EC353D64640C393AFC192F17E1CED.description: Choose appropriate digital tools to accomplish a real-world task.

BF9B2FC389CC431EB493501CF7F7ED62.description:
DIGITAL TOOLS: Use tools to create, manipulate,
analyze, edit, publish or develop
digital objects.

7978A5BC32894F258B36BED236237832.description: STRAND: DIGITAL LITERACY: Learners use technology to find, evaluate, create and communicate information across disciplines in the school library and beyond.
